Title: Covid19 Emergency Relief for Homeless in London
Story: On 2 April we launched an emergency initiative after meeting homeless people who hadn't eaten for days due to the lock down. Since then we have been doing daily outreach to 250-350 homeless serving food  hot drinks and having conversations. In the first 6 weeks we have served more than 11 000 meals.    We are committed to continuing this work until normal support facilities for the homeless have reopened.     Under One Sky is a collective of private individuals. Nobody is employed by Under One Sky. Our work is 100% volunteer based.    There was a need to move so quickly we didn't have the resource to launch a new fund raising campaign for our Covid19 emergency initiative. Instead we decided to use our winter fund raising page. The text below is from that campaign.    ---------------------------    Since 2012 Under One Sky has supported more than 3000 people living on the streets of London. Over the coming winter months  we hope to reach another 1000 homeless during our night walks.     Our work is inspiring others to join the Under One Sky family with events being planned in Cambridge (UK)  Madrid  and Boston (US).    In the last 12 months 9000 slept rough in London - an increase of 18%. Deaths among homeless in England and Wales increased by 22% to 726 in the same period.    Under One Sky is a 100% volunteer run collective of 450 passionate people with full-time jobs and families. At our most recent events  more than 10% of volunteers were children and teenagers. Our founding principle is that humanity is ONE family regardless of nationality  race  religion  class or any other label.    On cold winter nights we meet the homeless in a spirit of compassion and with a genuine desire to connect. To make them feel they belong in this world just as much as anyone else. Letting them know they have not been forgotten.    We distribute life support packages: food  clothing  toiletries  sleeping bags  gift cards  books  and messages of hope and light for those living in some dark times in their lives. The gift cards can be used to buy tents  winter clothing  or other necessities – they are a life saver. Our mantra: “For a better tomorrow  you must survive today”.    We are completely reliant on private funds  and every penny we raise goes directly to the homeless people we serve. Your donation will be used to buy gift cards and supplies.    You Will Make A Difference    We can’t wait to bring your donation to those who are fighting every day to simply stay alive. Our first winter event this year will take place on the night of Saturday 14th December where we will support at least 250 homeless people.    If you are not able to donate  then we would love for you to share our campaign using the “Share” button (below the “Donate Now” button) or using this link: www.gofundme.com/f/underonesky-homelessaid2020    It is also possible to support by donating sleeping bags using our Amazon Wish list    Finally  you are welcome to send us a message for us to share with the homeless – simply contact us on this page.    To learn more about the potential impact of your support…read below about:    - Two homeless men we helped get off the streets and into jobs recently    - Our aim to raise awareness about the realities of homelessness    - Our "Very Important Homeless Person" entertainment events launching in 2020     “At least we are under the same sky – you and I.” Ranata Suzuki    Campaign Team    Under One Sky helps bring a voice to the homeless  when often it feels as though nobody is listening. By telling their stories we hope to raise awareness to the realities about what being homeless truly means. We aim to educate and inspire more people to reach out and take action.    In early 2020 we will launch our first Very Important Homeless Person (VIHP) event. An afternoon of food and entertainment (music  talks  comedy) exclusively for the homeless – a moment to feel “normal”. We have support from a major music company who will help source artists  and a UK comedy streaming platform.    The real impact your support can have….    Last year  our Embankment team met Robert  who to their surprise was working for UberEats despite sleeping on the streets. He used our £30 gift card to buy a mobile charger for his bicycle so he would no longer lose out on income when charging his phone. The team were so impressed with Robert that we looked for other ways to support him. One afternoon we told his story on Facebook with a call out for job opportunities and housing. In a few hours he had four job interviews and two people offering him free temporary housing. Robert moved in the next day and had a job a week later. We also sponsored him so he could visit his mother who was diagnosed with cancer.    Two years ago  our Oxford Street team met a young homeless man named Singh and changed his life immediately. With their encouragement and a £30 gift card he bought a mobile phone and contacted his family. Our team were also able to arrange a job interview. Within six days Singh had a flat and a job. One year later he joined the same Oxford Street team that had helped him  to support other homeless people. Since then  Singh has been promoted twice at work  and is now saving up to buy a property.    We have heard many heart-breaking street stories over the years but often told by people with immense life spark. We have brought many smiles  hugs  and lifesaving supplies to those same people and we hope to bring many more this winter with your help.    Supporters

Title: Let's end rough sleeping in London
Story: Donate today - help make sure no-one needs to sleep rough in London again.    We’ve all seen people sleeping rough near where we live and work. Rough sleeping has more than doubled in London since 2010. During the past year alone  almost 9 000 people were seen sleeping out on London’s streets.    Welfare changes  soaring housing costs  and a shortage of affordable accommodation mean that more and more people are left with nowhere they can call home. The London Homeless Collective (29 charities with decades of experience in tackling homelessness) are working with the Mayor of London and local councils to provide services to help people rough sleeping to leave the streets.     Every Londoner can help too. You can donate to the London Homeless Collective so that we can offer more support to help people leave the streets and rebuild their lives.    Each member of this group has a specific project – such as providing emergency accommodation  longer-term support  or providing advice and assistance - that will benefit from your support. By giving your money to this coalition of charities  you can be confident that your donation will be distributed fairly and provide real help for people sleeping rough.     The Mayor of London  Sadiq Khan said: “The number of people sleeping rough on our streets is a national disgrace  and since becoming Mayor I have made it a priority to do everything in my power to tackle this crisis.    “The generosity of Londoners is well known  especially at this time of year  so I implore everyone to give what they can to help some of the most vulnerable people in our society.    “Every year we help record numbers through my winter programme - and while this is a testament to the hard work of outreach workers and shelter staff  it is also a damning indictment of the Government’s failure to get to grips with this vitally important issue.”     If you would like to find out more about the projects that will be funded email lhcg@homelesslink.org.uk    The London Homeless Collective comprises:    The 999 Club and Lady Florence Trust  The Albert Kennedy Trust  Barons Court Project  Caritas - Anchor House  Centrepoint Soho  The Church Army  The Connection at St Martins-in the-Fields  Crisis UK  Depaul UK  Evolve Housing + Support  Glass Door Homeless Charity  Homeless Action in Barnet  Homeless Link  Housing Justice  Kingston Churches Action on Homelessness  LookAhead  New Horizon Youth Centre  Providence Row  The Salvation Army  Shelter  the National Campaign for Homeless People Limited  The Single Homeless Project  Spear Housing Association Limited  St Mungo Community Housing Association  Thames Reach Charity  The Big Issue Foundation  Passage 2000  West London Mission Methodist Circuit  National Council of Young Men's Christian Associations  Veteran's Aid.    Homeless Link is managing and coordinating the equal distribution of donations across the London Homeless Collective coalition.     A bit about the process:    We are fortunate to have the support of GoFundMe who donated £5 000 towards the winter campaign and who have been incredibly supportive throughout the planning and launch stages. GoFundMe do not charge any platform fees. A processing fee of 1.9% and 20p applies to all donations. If you choose to claim Gift Aid on your donation  100% of this will be delivered to the charities. All funds will be distributed by PayPal Giving Fund to Homeless Link  who will distribute them equally between the 29 member charities.     Please do get in touch if you have any questions about the appeal or our work. Contact lhcg@homelesslink.org.uk

There is less access to food  and we are meeting that need by increasing our outreach  visiting the homeless men and women where they sleep on the streets most nights to ensure they have hot food  sandwiches  hot and cold drinks and other essentials that they need. But it's costing us around £100 per week just in fuel to keep going to provide these essentials. We have to keep going  we can't leave these men and women during this time of crisis  they can't go inside  they can't self isolate  and they still need food and drinks. Please help us wherever you can  Covid-19 is hard for all of us  but it's particularly hard for those who don't have a home  and can't close their front door to keep safe. Title: Blackpool Homeless Community
Location: Blackpool, North West England, United Kingdom
Story: There are approximately 80 people living on the streets of Blackpool  these are made up of men and women of all ages.    In this day and age nobody should be living on the streets  everybody should have a place they can call home or a place they feel safe.    Many homeless people in Blackpool have been issued with dispersal orders by simply doing nothing wrong  I personally have come in to contact with some that have been issued with one as they've been sitting in a shop doorway keeping themselves to themselves or been getting their head down for the night on a street. How is this fair  they have nowhere to go? No home  no safe place! They just get moved on to which they locate at another place until they are moved on again.    The homeless need the help of the public to make them feel as though they have a purpose in life  to help them out of the vicious circle they find themselves in as nobody chooses to live on the streets. All they want is a normal life like the rest of us without being judged for the situation they've found themselves in.    I'm not saying I have the answers to be able to resolved this issue however I feel I can make a difference by raising awareness and help raise funds to support people in their time of need so this is why I've decided to do a 2 day sleep out to raise funds to support those in need of a homeless support kit.    I will be looking to do a 2 day sleep out in Blackpool starting Thursday 21st November at 12 midday and finishing on Saturday 23rd November at 12 midday.    I'm hoping to raise £1000 which will be to purchase the homeless support kit bag which will including the following items:    A camping rucksack to be able to carry their belongings  A tent   Waterproof coat & pants  Sleeping bag   Hat  scarf and gloves  Foil blanket  First aid kit  Cleansing & welfare pack which will consist of items such as toothbrush  toothpaste  shampoo  body wash  underwear  tissues    Please consider donating as much or as little as possible as every penny will help me purchase these essential items for the homeless.    Upon receiving donations  items will be purchase and published via an update along with a receipt showing items purchased.    Thank you for taking the time to visit and read my story.    Kind Regards   Tom    P.S - Please feel free to email helpblackpoolhomeless2019@gmail.com for any questions you may have or any donations you would like to make from the list above. We ask all cash donations are made through this page.

Title: Support Homeless Jaffa
Location: Liverpool, North West England, United Kingdom
Story: Jaffa lost his flat a few years ago and didn’t tell anyone he had fell on hard times. Instead he got a tent and sleeping bag and lived in a field in Litherland until kids starting constantly hassling him. Then a kind landlord heard of his problems and let him live in the back garden of the Red Lion pub. On 22nd Dec the landlord is leaving and Jaffa’s future is uncertain. He doesn’t have drug  alcohol  or mental health issues  so falls between the cracks of council support. He has never signed on the dole and instead  works 12 hrs a days  walking round the pubs of Liverpool selling socks  towels  or boxer shorts  if he doesn’t sell his stock  he doesn’t eat. Most days he lives on £5 a day for food.     He was born and bred in Nottingham. He told his jamaican mum at 7 that one day he would move to Liverpool to follow the mighty reds and by 12 he was living there. He followed Liverpool everywhere  and the kop could often be heard sing Jaffa Jaffa give us a song.     Please support him  winter is coming and no one should live like this.

Title: Now unemployed & homeless due to Corona shutdown
Location: West Layton, Yorkshire and the Humber, United Kingdom
Story: Life has been turned upside down for a lot of people  but in my case having just been fired from a job that was a Live-In position running a boutique countryside hotel I am now up the creek without a paddle.    This has now left me unemployed and essentially homeless.     With no transport (it came with the job) or prospect of being able to rent a property in the current situation I've had to use the last of any savings to buy a van to secure my belongings and to call home for the next few months or until normality restores and things start to look up.     The van will give me a roof and travel options  two birds with one stone.     Unfortunately the van isn't quite yet liveable  with no windows  insulation and a much used trade interior it needs a fair bit of work and a basic fit of plywood before I can fit in a bed  stay relatively clean  warm and not damp.    I have found a company that can do it  but now need the funds to store all my belongings and get the van there and back.    Any help at all would be a huge help! and the thanks will never be forgotten.    Thank you   Dan

Title: Let's end rough sleeping in London
Story: Donate today - help make sure no-one needs to sleep rough in London again.    We’ve all seen people sleeping rough near where we live and work. Rough sleeping has more than doubled in London since 2010. During the past year alone  almost 9 000 people were seen sleeping out on London’s streets.    Welfare changes  soaring housing costs  and a shortage of affordable accommodation mean that more and more people are left with nowhere they can call home. The London Homeless Charities Group (22 charities with decades of experience in tackling homelessness) are working with the Mayor of London and local councils to provide services to help people rough sleeping to leave the streets.     Every Londoner can help too. You can donate to the London Homeless Charities Group so that we can offer more support to help people leave the streets and rebuild their lives.    Each member of this group has a specific project – such as providing emergency accommodation  longer-term support  or providing advice and assistance - that will benefit from your support. By giving your money to this coalition of charities  you can be confident that your donation will be distributed fairly and provide real help for people sleeping rough.     However much you are able to give this summer  you will be helping someone who is in crisis to access the support they need to stay off the streets for good.     The Mayor of London  Sadiq Khan  said:     “Even one person sleeping rough in London is one too many  which is why I’m asking Londoners to join me on my mission to end homelessness.     “Last year winter Londoners generously donated almost £250 000 to homelessness charities  and made a record number of referrals through StreetLink  which helps outreach workers find rough sleepers and offer them support. This summer  we’ve once again brought together 22 charities running homelessness projects who Londoners can give money to  both through this single donation page.     “I urge Londoners to get involved  donate  and join me in doing all we can to help make homelessness a thing of the past.”    Sign up if you would like to receive updates about how the Mayor is helping rough sleepers off the streets .     If you would like to find out more about the projects that will be funded email lhcg@homelesslink.org.uk    The London Homeless Charities Group comprises:    Homeless Link is managing and coordinating the equal distribution of donations across the London Homeless Charities Group coalition.     A bit about the process:  We are fortunate to have the support of GoFundMe who donated £5 000 towards the winter campaign and who have been incredibly supportive throughout the planning and launch stages. GoFundMe do not charge any platform fees. A processing fee of 1.9% and 20p applies to all donations. If you choose to claim Gift Aid on your donation  100% of this will be delivered to the charities. All funds will be distributed by PayPal Giving Fund to Homeless Link  who will distribute them equally between the 22 member charities.     Please do get in touch if you have any questions about the appeal or our work. Contact lhcg@homelesslink.org.uk

Title: Feeding and Clothing the Homeless
Location: Liverpool, North West England, United Kingdom
Story: My name is Angela Hamlett and together with my friend  Nic Gill  we visit Liverpool City Centre weekly providing much needed warm clothing (including socks and underwear)  a hot meal  hot drink and packed lunch to the homeless people of Liverpool.  We are not part of a charitable organisation and initially funded this ourselves.  We are both working mothers with the usual busy lifestyle however wanted to give something back to people less fortunate than ourselves.Thanks to the amazing power of social media  we have gained a substantial following.  The support we receive is outstanding.  We have also received a substantial amount of donations in the form of non-perishable food and drinks together with second hand clothing.Friends have helped support us financially as well and my employer has also provided much needed funding.  This has enabled us to continue doing what we are doing and to hopefully continue for a very long time.  The reason for setting up this Go Fund Me page is because people are asking if they can transfer money to us and we are only setting this up at the request of our friends and family.  We have never and will never ask you to give money or indeed anything other than second hand goods or goods which are no longer needed however if people have contacted us asking us to set this page up  then we feel it will be very beneficial to our cause.Nic and myself have been doing this for around 6 months now and have already seen first hand the desperate situation these people are in and by doing what we do  we hope that we pass the message on to these people that somebody does care.  If we can ease their discomfort  even just by having a chat and giving them clean clothing or bedding  then it is worth it for us.     Please take a moment to look through this spreadsheet.  You will see just how far your money can go.  A hot meal of corned beef hash and beans is less than 70p!  We have calculated for £1.20 we can provide a hot meal  hot drink  a packed lunch and bottle of water! We always give weekly updates of how we are getting on and who we have met and pass on stories from our homeless friends for you to read.  If you are on Facebook and interested  please send a friend request to Angela Hamlett and you will be able to see the work we carry out for yourselves. If you would like any more information regarding our work  please do not hesitate to contact myself or Nic. Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and we look forward to hearing from you soon.

Title: Help A HOMELESS Hero
Location: Merstham, South East England, United Kingdom
Story: https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-6737959/Homeless-police-officer-army-veteran-shows-important-helpline-heroes.html          Having been let down by the system and people within the Organisation the situation has become critical for Dexy. I know people who wouldn’t have survived this long.     I’ve had the pleasure of meeting Dex. He’s a serving police officer for over 10 years who joined after 13 years in HM Forces-Royal engineer Bomb Disposal and high risk search team commander. Like too many of our friends  families and colleagues Dex has hit tough times. After being diagnosed with PTSD in 2017 by Combat stress Dex was unable to carry on working. Following 6 months of being off sick from work he went onto half pay and 6 months later he was on NO PAY. As happens to all too many Dex’s marriage broke down due to the stress of his illness and he found himself homeless. Yes. A serving police officer sleeping rough! This stuff happens. Who cares for the carers when it all goes wrong. We do. A man who has served his Country and given over 17 years of public service now needs the GREAT British public to repay their thanks by small donations. Lots of small donations add up. I want to secure his safety and well being for the next 6 months whilst we support him into some housing pending being retired on ill health.     He’s a good man who needs our help. Please help me help Dex.

Title: Homeless Dogs&Puppies Of Istanbul Food Appeal
Location: Bury, North West England, United Kingdom
Story: This is my Incredible friend Oben Aras!  (Not just a Facebook friend but an actual friend from our college years)    Oben lives in Istanbul  Turkey  and I cannot put into words how selfless this woman is. She walks the streets both day and night tirelessly feeding and caring for the many homeless  unfed and often poorly dogs &puppies of Turkey. she does so primarily from her own pocket and any food donations people are kind enough to sometimes offer. She sends me the videos of her endless work regularly  and though it’s heartwarming to watch  it’s also heartbreaking at the same time! Oben always puts the needs of these dogs before that of her own! And for this reason I’m more than proud to call her my friend❤️❤️❤️ Unfortunately today she sent me a really upsetting message  one she has never sent me before in all our decades of friendship  and it broke my heart to read it:     “Hi Danielle  I dont know how to ask this so I'm just gonna ask You know I currently have about 40 something dogs in my direct care and I feed them everyday... I use a pack of dog food everyday which is 15 kilos. Up until this year I managed to get some help from people who donated dog food to me... but this year I am literally on my own... And I am financially done for  I cannot afford more food right now. But these dogs rely on me&I dont know what to do...    I’ve even been buying chicken and boiling and mixing it with pasta! they like it but its just not enough...   I was wondering if you could maybe organise some sort of food donation thing for me... I never ever ever accept money... only dog food!!!! https://www.carrefoursa.com/tr/jetix-kuzu-etli-kopek-mamasi-15-kg-p-30257508This is a very reliable web site and very good dog food for very resonable price...I think its about £10 a pack (15 kilos) .... ı am so sorry for asking this I would never ask if I wasnt desperate. You know that. İf any one you know is interested in donating I could give you my address and they could order&send the food directly to me...    I just came from feeding them and today I had to add bread to their food... This is the hardest message I have ever had to send And I’m so so sorry for asking this of you! But I am so very desperate. Oben”    Anybody who knows me is fully aware of my love for animals  but Oben goes above and beyond to help these dogs. She even takes them to the vets for treatment whenever she can afford to. So I’m asking on behalf of my amazing friend  if anyof my other friends or family could send her a helping hand As Oben said herself: she never accepts money  only dog food! And so I have set up this page in the hope that anybody wanting to help-can either order her a bit of food from the above website  and I can give you her postal address  or if you could donate however much you can spare  every single pound or penny would be much appreciated and ever so helpful  then we can hopefully order her a bulk amount of food and get it to her urgently.     I’ve never done a GoFundMe before  but I can’t think of a better reason to do one  as I know her personally  and I know how much this will mean to her and her cause.  I have set the goal amount of £560 as this would provide 2 months worth of food!!! A huge Thank you from both of us     Danielle & Oben xXx

Title: Homeless sister and toddler in need
Location: Chatham, South East England, United Kingdom
Story: My name is Ayman and I am raising on behalf of a sister. On Wednesday 9th of December 2015  I witnessed something very disturbing and until today it is very much bothering me.    The sister and her toddler have been sofa surfing for the past 2 years now  due to dire circumstances. The last place where she was staying  she had to move out of a few weeks ago. Her last resort was to move with her mother who is not muslim. The mother HATES the fact she is muslim. When she went back  her mother was causing arguments with her. She even called the police (Friday 4th of December) on the sister for saying she delibrately broke off a door handle of the lounge door. Hence the lounge door was already broken.....it was bound to fall off eventually.  When police arrived on the Friday night  the police said the call was a waste of their time.   The sister decided to leave for the weekend and stay with a friend for a few days until the situation calms down.    On the Monday 7th of December 2015 when she attempted to re enter the house the locks were changed. She called her mother on the Monday and the Tuesday and her mother ignored every single call. On the Wednesday the sister tried again and to her findings her mother had blocked her number.  Myself (Ayman) and others accomapanied the sister and her toddler to the mothers property  on the purpose to get answers and get all her belongings from the house. When we arrived  we rang the door bell the mother looked through the door and refused to open the door. We were knocking for over an hour. What got to me is that knowing her grandchild was out in the cold and rain for over an hour  and she can hear the cries. She called the police on the sister once again. Alhamdulillah the sister didn't get arrested. We explained that we needed to get all her belongings from the property. The police said she could get some items but not all.  We had to get a storage on behalf of the sister to put her items in alhamdulillah. The sister had no where to go and wanted to stay in the storage. We managed to put them somewhere for a few nights alhamdulillah.    Her mother is now refusing for her to get the rest of her items subhanAllah. She has threatened her with an injunction and apparently she is filing papers to the court so that she can not be in a certain amount of distance of her house.  Also her family members are of no help whatsover.    The sisters name is on the council (government) waiting list and the bourough she is under has limited properties. She has updated them with the recent events and they said she has to make a whole new application and provide new documents. Some of these documents has to come from the mother who is refusing to give them to her. The council are saying they will not process nothing unless they have everything.     I want to raise this money for the sister and her child inshaaAllah. So they can have peace of mind. The money will be used to pay for a place to rent by a muslim landlord in London UK for a year inshaaAllah. This will help her tremendously inshaAllah and make her get back on her feet.    Please donate anything you can even if its a penny inshaAllah.    May Allah reward you all for sharing this and donating Ameen

Title: Winter Aid for London's homeless
Story: In the last 6 years we have supported 2500 homeless people. This winter we hope to make that 3000.    Under One Sky is run on a 100% voluntary basis from private donations. Every penny we receive ends up as support for the homeless. Our 400 volunteers make it possible for us to come to them on the streets.    During the winter we hand out gift cards  clothing  sleeping bags  meals  books and messages of hope and light to the homeless. The gift cards can be used to buy tents  winter clothing or other life necessities.    It all starts with meeting the homeless in the spirit of compassion. To make them feel they belong in this world just as much as anyone else. That they have not been forgotten - 8000 people slept rough in London in the last year.    Under One Sky was founded on the principle that humanity is ONE family…we are brothers and sisters regardless of nationality  race  religion  class or any other label.    “Only from the heart can you touch the sky.” Rumi    Unspoken Truths    Our street teams get to the truths that politicians and sensational headlines hardly touch.    · We hear of lives filled with trauma and rejection right from childhood.    · Deep emotional scars leading to mental health issues. 90% of homeless have mental health issues – depression being the most common.    · Not to mention the lives of friends lost. In the past year 440 homeless people died in the UK – right before our eyes.     But other truths you rarely hear about either are:    · The level of empathy among many homeless that most of us struggle to match.    · The wisdom and social intelligence gained from a life of struggle.    · The courage to tell strangers about their deepest scars and to let the tears flow.    You Make A Difference    Your funds will be spent on buying gift cards to shops that sell basic necessities such as tents  sleeping bags and winter clothing. These will be handed out at our Night for the Homeless events in London. The math is simple…for every £5000 we raise we reach 150 homeless people.    To appreciate your potential impact read two stories from our 2017/18 winter events below.    We can’t wait to bring your donation to those who are fighting to stay alive daily. Our first winter event is on 15 Dec 2018.    If you are not in a position to donate then we’d love shout-out on Facebook  LinkedIn  Twitter  Instagram etc.    Street Success Stories    Our team who covered Oxford Street for our January event made an incredible difference to a homeless man’s life in less than a week. The team had a long chat with him and gave him the encouragement needed to get him to contact his estranged brother. The man used the £30 gift card we gave him to buy a mobile and minutes. He contacted his brother and within 2 days the brother had arranged for accommodation in a flat share. A huge win. One of the team members told him of a job opportunity at a company. A job interview arranged. He nailed the interview and got the job…and ended up being promoted within probation period. In 6 days  he went from the street to being housed and employed.    In Dec 2017 our Camden team met a homeless couple (G and L). G (male) was serving in the British Army in Afghanistan when a car crash took his wife and three daughters. His world crumbled…he lost job and home. L  his now female partner (then friend)  stuck by him as his life disappeared like sand between his fingers. When our team met G he was undergoing chemotherapy on NHS. Sleeping on the streets…and receiving chemo. Two team members Mark and Marnie helped the couple with a deposit on a studio flat. With a roof over their heads L landed an office job and G landed a carpentry job. In only a few months this couple had a new path ahead of them.    We have heard many heart-breaking street stories over the years but often told by people with immense life spark. We have brought many smiles and hugs to those same people and we hope to bring many more this winter with your help.    Campaign Team        Supporters

Title: London Homeless Welfare Team coronavirus help

We recently visited local businesses around north London to collect donations which we are very grateful for namely: Tesco  Sainsbury's  Poundland  Weston Park Bakery  Crouch appreciation Society and Rowans Tenpin bowls. We set up by Finsbury Park Bridge on New Year’s Day and handed out hot soups  tea  coffee  cakes  baguette’s  chocolates and sanitary items which were requested upon a recent survey. We also offered hot drinks to passers by who were also very grateful as this initiative is a community project. We hope to continue doing this for the homeless every month. We will be liaising with local councils/ churches/ community centres etc to discuss options/initiative’s we can put in place to make this go from strength to strength. Title: Ramadan In Marrakesh Project 2020
Location: Bolton, North West England, United Kingdom
Story: UPDATE: COVID-19    Due to the current situation  we have decided to do things a little different this year to ensure we can still continue with the project. Instead of renting a hall  cooking meals and serving the food to the community indoors  we have decided to make food hampers and deliver them.    We will be delivering food hampers to families who are struggling financially and cannot afford basic kitchen essentials. The hampers will include all essential ingredients to help families to prepare food. For example  they will receive oil  sugar  tea  perishable goods  flour  jam and cheese ..    As the community attempts to reduce social contact  we decided it’s not appropriate to deliver the project in the usual way. However  it’s important that we help those families in need who are left without work and cannot access local shops due to health conditions putting them at further risk. We have been given authroisation to deliver food instead.   PLEASE READ OUR STORY!   Each year  during the month of Ramadan  we fundraise to feed the homeless community  in Marrakech.    The Moroccan association  Massar for Cultures and Art  is a not-for-profit organisation  which runs various volunteering community projects. These projects include supporting orphanages  children and adults with disabilities  delivering activities for children on the streets  and feeding the homeless. The association also performs theatre shows in the community and delivers workshops in other villages.     During the holy month of Ramadan  our charity runs a food kitchen for the homeless  in Marrakech. Food is provided for 150 homeless people everyday for Iftar  over the 30 days (23/04/20 - 22/05/20). As Ramadan is fast approaching  we are (hopefully) able to fundraise £1500 (18 000 MAD) to fund the feeding homeless project during Ramadan. All money raised goes directly towards buying food and cooking materials for the project. As you can see from the pictures  we have limited resources and feed a vast number of people over the course of the month. It is important that we have enough funds to run the programme successfully. Basic things  such as bowls  plates and plastic cups  are needed as well as food ingredients. If anyone would like to donate or send plastic plates  cups etc. i can take these donations or send you an address.    Last year  we managed to raise just over £1000  which was fabulous but it wasn’t enough to fund the whole month of Ramadan. This year  we are hoping to raise a little more with your kind donations  so that we are able to provide more and a wider variety of food over the course of the month.     I first began volunteering with the Moroccan charity in May 2018 and supported this project throughout the holy month of Ramadan. All the volunteers do an incredible job and providing food for the homeless community in Marrakech was a very rewarding experience! Please watch the youtube video and see the attached pictures to see just how much of a difference our donations make.  https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=xItEgNxGSUE&feature=youtu.be    Thanks for reading!

Title: Homeless at Christmas
Story: Last Christmas Eve we went into Leicester town with hot sausage and bacon cobs for the homeless with a few blankets  pairs of socks and gloves. The people we spoke to were so grateful and wouldn’t accept the food if they’d already eaten saying to give it somebody else that may not have had food that day. One of them wouldn’t take the gloves as he already had a pair and said to save them for someone who needed them more than him. How selfless if that! Not greedy and not one of them approached us. Despite being sat in the freezing cold with nowhere to go and no Christmas to look forward to  they were all still smiling and wishing us a Merry Christmas. We take for granted so much and don’t realise how lucky we are to have a home to go to and to have people around us who care. I know some people have made bad decisions in their lives but it’s not always their fault that they’ve ended up in that situation. That’s why I’m asking for a little help so that this Christmas Eve we can give more than a few blankets here and there. I’d like to get sleeping bags  blankets  hats  socks  thermals and hot food & hot drinks. Even if it puts a smile of their faces for a just that moment. Whether you believe in giving to charities or not  these are people sleeping outside in the cold  starving and alone in our communities.

Title: Let's help 12yr old Raghu and his Mum find a home
Story: Let’s help 12 year old Raghu and his Mum Suman Ben put a roof over their head this Christmas.    12 year old Raghu and his Mum Suman  are currently homeless in Ahmedabad  India. They live together at the end of a footpath on the side of a road.     She became homeless six years ago when her husband sadly passed away. This was made worse by an unfortunate accident  where she lost her right hand.    Suman struggles has problems walking and needs medical assistance. She also has a problem in one of her eyes that needs urgent medical attention.    With only one hand  she has struggled to find enough work to support herself and her young boy. She survives by doing basic tailoring work on the street for small change.    In the UK we have support systems in place to make sure that children have shelter. Raghu doesn’t have that. He sleeps outside with his Mum at the end of a footpath  where they’re vulnerable to predators and the elements.    This family needs a little human kindness to help get back on their feet. Let’s work together to get this family into a safe  warm home and help this young boy get an education to better his chances in life.     Suman has an elder Son who lives nearby  but has no resources to help her. We’d like to get little Raghu and his Mother into an apartment nearby the elder Son  so that he can support them with day to day things  within his capabilities.     We want to raise enough money to:    · find a rental apartment for them which has kitchen facilities  heating and hot water. (approx. £60 per month) and cover the rent for at least twelve months    · Cover basic utility and living expenses for the same period    · provide them both with basic furniture  utensils and food    · buy clean clothes & shoes for them both.    · To provide access to a Doctor & Dentist for a check-up and any medicine they need.    · help Suman Ben find some work or access welfare to secure a source of income.    · help Raghu enrol in school and catch up on his missed education.    · Pay a trusted local person with use of a car to transport them to various appointments to facilitate the above things.    We’d like to raise at least £5 000 for this family. Please dig deep and help us turn this heart-breaking tale into a success story. Little Raghu and his Mum are counting on us.    Thank you everyone – every penny counts.

Title: Hygiene Kits for Homeless
Story: I am raising money to provide 500 Emergency Hygiene Kits for the people still sleeping rough in Hackney but with hardly any access to facilities or even running water.   Hopefully drop-in centres and other facilities will be able to open safely soon  but in the meantime we need to act quickly to help.   Any help highly appreciated  the rough sleepers will be grateful.  I have seen the situation at Trafalgar Square  where I am helping handing out food to the homeless  it is quite sad to see so many people still on the street  numbers rising  with less support than before. It won't solve the problem  but the kits will at least ease the situation for the individuals temporarily. For the kit we will need:     Plastic or Tote bags  2 litres bottle of water  hand sanitiser  toothpaste  toothbrush and cover of folding brush  deodorant  Soap bar  6 pack of tissues  Facial wipes  Wet toilet wipes  chocolate bars    MORE DETAIL ABOUT THE PLAN AND HOW YOU CAN HELP HERE:  https://www.notion.so/Emergency-Hygiene-Kits-Appeal-3bebf69279a24db7a1a5bf4a6f15d2d2    With the help of volunteers from Hoxton West Mutual Aid and Re-action I hope to get 500 kits together over the next 4 weeks  125 a week  to be distributed in Hackney in liaison with the outreach organisations  who provide food all over the borough. Surplus to be distributed in other hotspots  like Trafalgar Square and King's Cross.    Please give what you can – if you are still paid  think about how much money you are saving right now :-)

Title: SUNDERLAND SOUP KITCHEN & FOODBANK FUNDRAISER 2019
Location: Sunderland, North East England, United Kingdom
Story: Christmas is one of the toughest times of the year for lots of people. Whilst many families over-indulge during the festive period  others struggle to put even the most basic meal on the table to feed their family - a harrowing reality of where Britain is at in 2019.    At the heart of Football is community  and at the heart of community are good people willing to dedicate their time and money to supporting those in need. No one wants to rely on food banks or soup kitchens to feed their children  but while we may feel powerless to fight the institution that has caused his hardship  we can fight to bring a modicum of security to the most vulnerable by giving a few spare coins or an hour of our time over to a cause like this. Where people would otherwise face malnourishment  food banks are the flickering flame of a beacon in an otherwise dark night.    The people at the Sunderland Foodbank and the Sunderland Community Soup Kitchen do an amazing job of ensuring that families and homeless people all over Wearside don’t go without - but unless people assist with their kind donations  none of it is possible.    Whatever you can give  it all helps.    - We have chosen this year to support the Sunderland Community Soup Kitchen and the Sunderland Foodbank  with all donations going to the two organisations. Please give generously - support your local community at this difficult time.    - On Wednesday 11th of December we will proceed with distributing the funds to the two charities  who will use the money this Christmas to feed the hungry and homeless in Sunderland. Sunderland Community Soup Kitchen feed people seven days a week and will now be able to buy pallets of fresh produce to cook with  whilst the foodbank will be able to use the money to produce emergency three day food parcels.

Title: Help Support Bristol’s Homeless Care Packages
Location: Thornbury, South West England, United Kingdom
Story: This year  instead of Christmas presents  I am asking my family  friends & community to donate what they can towards helping me make homeless care packages for those in need in Bristol.    These packages will include things such as: personal care items  single serve foods  warm clothing (mainly socks and gloves)  reusable water bottles  flasks  dog food & treats (where applicable)  waterproof bag/backpack to hold it all  and more.    I want to make up as many care packages as I can with these donations to help as many people as possible  which will be distributed with the help of a friend in December.    Thank you in advance for helping me with my Christmas wish!    ”When we give cheerfully  and accept gratefully  everyone is blessed” - Maya Angelou

Title: A Gift for the Homeless
Location: Holiday Inn Express, Greater London, United Kingdom
Story: So recently I have spent quite a bit of time in London particularly the Old street area  and have noticed as the days get colder and wetter there are more homeless on the streets. I have been on nights out where drunk people have stepped on and kicked over someones pot of money and laughed and am found disgusted by the way that some humans treat other humans. I give away my change when I have some however with contactless banking nowadays etc barely any of us carry change anymore. I see the homeless struggle at this time of year  with everyone saving money and spending on Christmas and presents and would love to give something small to a handful of people who must use the concrete as a bed at night and may not have a Christmas dinner. Unwrapping a christmas present is something we all take for granted and it could help someone who is lost keep hope! Isabel De La Paz and I are looking to raise £100 in 10 days in order to buy a few small gifts for the homeless to keep them warm this Christmas  if you can give anything towards that we would be extremely grateful  the more we can raise the more people we can reach! If you are unable to donate please share this page for awareness! Be grateful this Christmas :)

Title: Supporting Anthony to get a better life
Location: Hastings, South East England, United Kingdom
Story: I would like to raise money for this man  I believe his name is Anthony. I saw his tent and his message next to it and it broke my heart. There is a caravan for sale and it cost £100  the goal is £300 as it needs some work done and we’d need to get some basic necessities for him.     Any money will be greatly appreciated. THANK YOU :) x    We have been very lucky with the donations for Anthony he has been coming along in leaps and bounds   We would really like to put some of the money towards other people we know would benefit as well   we are hoping to be able to help others who want to help themselves to a better life we are unable to start a charity at the moment but this is something we have been looking into with help from people who understand more about the situations there are unfortunately so many people who sleep rough through no fault of their own .     We understand if this is not what you intended your donation for and if you feel you would like your returned please feel free to request it.     When we are able to access the funds we will be depositing the funds on to a pre paired credit card as we do not have a bank account to put the funds into at the moment   as soon as its cleared we are having a meeting with a local organisation who are better informed on helping homeless people.    Anthony is getting on great these days he has been very lucky and we have introduced him to some people who are leading him in the right direction we are hoping this will lead to a permanent position for him who knows watch this space ....

Title: Sutton Night Watch Homeless Charity
Story: Sutton Night Watch is a registered charity (1171903) which was set up to support and raise awareness for the homeless people within the London Borough of Sutton and surrounding areas. A group of volunteers give up their time to run the kitchen and food/clothes bank.    Our full-time premises is now open at 35 Manor Road  Wallington  Surrey which  along with the above support  will offer further services for our users  including online access to job/health services  showers  clothes washing facilities and a full-time kitchen.    We are so thankful for all the support that has been given to us so far and would love you to continue to support us for this wonderful cause.  THANKYOU !

Title: Helping Homeless Veterans UK
Location: Poole, South West England, United Kingdom
Story: After over 4 years of helping to assist over 150 Veterans into their own accomodation it is now time to utilise my skills by setting up this CIC with two amazing trustees and ambassadors as well as a huge team of volunteers. Using the knowledge that we have gained using legislation that is in place to help house our veterans  we wish to continue to work with local authorities and councils to make sure that they are all abiding by the Acts that are in place. We have contacts with over 80 local authorities and councils who are abiding by legislation and we hope to continue and make many more working relationships. However we can only carry out this work with the help of the general public. Whilst working with legislation will save a huge amount of money there are still costs involved with providing deposits or rent in advance as well as furniture  clothing and welfare support etc etc. We will carry on our working relationships with many other organisations and charities and we have the full support of many influential individuals within government and the MOD. 100% of money raised will be used to help our veterans as nobody is taking any wages. I have been asked to go along this route of setting this CIC up by many friends and supporters of the work that i do and whilst i am no fan of GO Fund Me pages  this is the only way i can raise the funds needed. Our two Trustees are Lord Stephen of Westbury who has great influence in the charity sector and is also a veteran himself and we have WOII Neil Hague who is currently serving in The Royal Military Police and has a huge amount of contacts and influence combined with his job role. Our Two Ambassadors are Samantha Bunford and Samantha Shapley who are both so passionate about making a difference to the Veterans that have served our country and have worked alongside myself for over 2 yrs. The volunteers we have in place have been with me for over 3 years and together we make a formidable team and we work on the ethos of there is no ( I ) in Teamwork. So there we are. We are hoping to become registered as a full charity within 6 months and whilst you may all say "" Not Another Charity "" which i understand please look at my record of housing veterans which i believe speaks for itself. Thankyou

Title: Help Zimbabwe's Homeless during COVID-19 lockdown
Story: Please help Vimba to buy buckets  soap and hand sanitisers for Zimbabweans to fight the war against COVID -19!    On Thursday 19 March 2020  Zimbabwe recorded its first COVID-19 case. Zimbabwe is undergoing a tough time economically and many Zimbabweans live hand to mouth and do not have much in terms of savings and stored goods in case of emergency.     When lockdown was announced on Friday 29 March 2020  many casual labour employees lost their form of income resulting in another crisis of how to feed their families.    Furthermore  with a lack of water facilities in many parts of the country  washing hands is not something that comes as easily as turning on a tap. Sanitisers are expensive and without an income  their small reserves will go to food.    By supplying buckets  soap and hand sanitisers it will give them a greater chance in fighting this pandemic!     http://www.vimba.co.uk/home/

Title: Helping the homeless in our community at Christmas
Location: Wirral, North West England, United Kingdom
Story: We have decided to set up a Go Fund Me page for homeless people across Merseyside  we’ll be splitting all donations between The Whitechapel Centre  the Charles Thompson Mission and the people themselves who are on the streets (in the form of take out food and hot drinks). All donations would be massively appreciated and as a company we’ll match whatever is donated.

Title: Container home for our homeless and their pets
Location: Stanningley, Yorkshire and the Humber, United Kingdom
Story: At Vulnerable Citizen Support  we have been following whats been going on around the UK & the world for the last 3 years. We are at a point where we believe we could help and support the start of a self-contained container home  if we can raise vital funds to start this project off.     We know that the crisis in Leeds is getting worse  if we can have these containers as a halfway point before they secure another pathway or permanent affordable social house.   This would also give us a base/Hub to be able to do vital paperwork/referrals to organisations that could vitally help at that moment with one of our guys who we help. We are going down the professional route with engaging with a local solicitors firm to form a professional organisation - fighting homelessness in Leeds called Vulnerable Citizen Support.     We have now joined forces with #Acecontainers in Leeds  one of the leading container firms in Leeds & the UK. This project has just become exciting with so many directions we can go down.     We are will be showing our #Pilot/#Model design within the coming weeks  with our spec being drawn out as we speak  we will be converting a 20x8 Container into a insulated 1 bedroom self contained home. With speaking with the design man (Dave) at #Acecontainers we aim to provide the following facilities.     1 x Shower   1 x Toilet   1 x Bed   1 x Drop Down Table   1 x Wardrobe     Cooking facilities will be separate for a Health & Safety point of view at the moment  we are asking for as much help as possible. Lately everybody has started to come together  contributing in many different ways.     This will be a project that needs alot of man time and power and will gain more experience as time goes on. You can pay into our paypal as well if you can only afford small amounts  Every penny counts guys.     paypal.me/leedstentcity1    Thank you for your support     Vulnerable Citizen Support (The old leeds tent city team)     'Assisting the most Vulnerable'

Title: Help the Homeless in London
Story: 'Anyone who looks after and works for a widow and a poor person is like a warrior fighting for Allah's cause  or like a person who fasts during the day and prays all night.' (Bukhari)    We serve on average 80 plates of hot food alhamdulillah.    Who Are We?  We are a small group of Muslim friends who feed the homeless twice a month and provide essentials like sleeping bags  rucksacks  tents  socks and  during winter months; gloves  balaclavas  winter socks and emergency blankets. Alhamdulillah we have been doing this for over 4 years in Charing Cross  London outside the Zimbabwean Embassy.    ​How Do Your Donations Help?  You provide warm food for those in need  you give them a warm place to sleep for the night  a shelter when it's windy or raining and a place to store their belongings. In the ice cold winter you help keep their hands  feet and faces from freezing.     Such A Blessing!  In February 2016 Allah blessed us with the ability to start our project and we started out distributing sandwiches  fruit  crisps and water. Al hamdulillah  shortly after we progressed to serving warm  cooked food  directly onto the service users plates. We have stuck to that method as we want to ensure the needy get wholesome warm food.     They Love the Chicken!   We have volunteers who cook; some regular  some when they can and the favourite food that we take down to the homeless is the 'chicken'! They love the chicken! Oh and hard boiled eggs! They love to take them for later when no food is available. A great source of protein.     Chicken and rice was on the menu!    Sleeping Bags  Tents  Rucksacks Etc.  We also progressed into taking down the essentials like sleeping bags etc. And have them on hand for anyone who asks  which they usually do and once you go to the car for one  the rest follow. So many are in need that we can't even supply for everyone as we just don't have the funding.     Man happily received a sleeping bag from our brother Abdul Raheem.     A homeless brother needed a rucksack.     Homelessness Isn't Racist  The homeless in London are from all over the World but primarily the UK and Europe. Muslim and non Muslim. Can you imagine sleeping on the ground without something to keep you warm  or in the rain with out a shelter  or no where to store the small amount of belongings that you have? We truly are blessed to have homes  and food to eat whenever we want. Al hamdulillah! Please be a part of making their lives better with the little that they have.     Yummy rice  chicken and vegetables during Ramadan. Date's too!    Please note  Prices for supplies are approximate depending on availability. We can't buy wholesale as we don't have the storage capacity so we buy from Ebay or Amazon at the best prices we can find at the time.

Title: Homeless mother of orphan children
Story: Asalamu Alaykum     I've created this page because I want to make a difference. In the video a woman in Somalia is begging the Muslim ummah for help.     Her husband recently passed away. Shortly after  her oldest son who provided for the family also passed away due to kidney failure. She is left with lots of orphan children and no one to support her. She previously lived in a "bull" i.e. a mud hut but due to being scared for the safety of her children and herself  she moved into a house. However  she is unable to pay her rent.     Good righteous deeds my brothers and sisters will benefit you on Yawmul-Qiyaamah (the Day of Resurrection). They are from the acts that will open up the gates of Jannah (Paradise) for you. Which will make weighty your scales and they will outweigh your sins.    Allāh SWT mentioned in the Quran “And march forth in the way (which leads to) forgiveness from your Lord  and for Paradise as wide as are the heavens and the earth  prepared for Al-Muttaqun. Those who spend [in Allah’s Cause – deeds of charity  alms  etc.] in prosperity and in adversity  who repress anger  and who pardon men; verily  Allah loves Al-Muhsinun (the good-doers)”. [sūrah āl-Im’rān 3:133]    The Messenger (ﷺ) said with regards to charity “And save yourselves from the hell fire even if it be with the piece of a date.”    Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was always generous during his lifetime but even more so in the sacred month of Ramadan.     Please help me help them by giving whatever you can using the 'Donate Now' button. The more people that know about this  the greater the impact  so please also spread the word by sharing my page with your friends and family.    Thank you in advance for your generosity  it means a lot!

Title: Raise The Roof Hull Homeless continued support
Location: Bransholme, Yorkshire and the Humber, United Kingdom
Story: Raise the roof is a non profit community organisation doing our best to look after the homeless and prevent people becoming homeless.  We run Wakey Wakey cafe 52 Beverley road which provides     Free breakfast for rough sleepers in the morning and free tea  coffee  advice  activities and support throughout the day.    A food club for people on low income to purchase food at a much lower price  proofs of benefits or low income must be given.    Indoor Soup kitchens on certain nights.    We have also put rough sleepers up in hotels at Xmas for the past 2 years.    All money donated will go towards helping the above things happen and keep them going.    You can't just take someone from the street surrounded by people  put them in a room with just 4 walls and expect them to get on with it. We believe the best way to raise a roof is by giving support and gaining the trust to help people adjust when they get in a property.  doing this we have helped over 100 people off the street and into accommodation over the past 2 years.  Thank you ❤️

Title: Glasgow Homeless Winter Sleep Out
Story: Hi folks      We at Aspire Housing and Personal Development Services will be taking part in this year's Sleep On The Street Event organised by Community group  Help The Homeless Glasgow.    On Saturday the 14th of December  our staff members will be equipped with our sleeping bags and pitching up for the night in Glasgow City Centre in a bid to raise awareness of the homelessness issue within our city.    As well as raising awareness and supporting Help The Homeless Glasgow in their Winter Sleeping Bag Appeal  we are also taking this opportunity to try and raise some funds for over 100 individuals that we support across our temporary accommodation services in the hope that we can ensure that every single person who is with us over the festive period has the best possible Christmas.     Just because people are in a temporary accommodation service does not mean that they have to spend it alone. Help us to make it a magical time for some of the most vulnerable people in our city. Every single donation recieved will go towards Christmas dinners  gifts and activities for all of our occupants.    Thank you

Title: Todos Together UK Homeless Appeal
Story: We serve around 200 people a week every Wednesday evening in Kings Cross and need to begin to provide winter essentials  such as sleeping bags  socks  hats and gloves.     As a small charity in its inception  we are raising much needed funds to help us become sustainable and be able to help more people. Long term  we plan on opening charity shops that will continue to help us grow and create revenue streams  which in turn allows to curate new projects such as workshops to train those on the street back into work.     Any donation towards supporting us in our outreach programme is much appreciated. Love and thanks to everyone that has supported in the past.     Billy    www.todostogether.com

Title: Hereford Homeless Support
Story: We have been focusing our efforts on basic survival provisions for those who are homeless in Hereford through the harsh winter months. We have been operating as an outreach support team to the most vulnerable and ensuring as many people as possible have shelter  warmth  food  drink and are shown kindness- the fundamental pillars of survival and wellbeing.     Before Christmas we set up a health and wellbeing day for those who are rough sleeping  sofa-surfing and families struggling to make ends meet in Hereford. The day was a great success with a huge response with donations in food  clothing  toys and we were able to make hampers to deliver to families in our community on Christmas Eve which also really made a difference!     On the day we had over 30 people  mostly who are rough sleeping and at the winter night shelter and we received fantastic feedback. They were able to get hot showers  have a hot meal  get a haircut and socialise with others not in their day-to-day circles and enjoyed the conversations. They were also able to take food and clothing away with them.    A few days after Christmas we received messages from people we had met on the day and some dangerous situations for those who weren’t staying at the shelter came to light. We are very aware of the amazing job the shelter  hot food provisions and all the other organisations involved in homelessness are doing  but we can’t help but see urgent needs which are easily solved in the short term for those still sleeping rough. We continue to distribute warm clothing  waterproof boots  shelter  coal and wood  food  hot water bottles and rucksacks full of basic survival resources. We have run two other provision and socials days and been out on foot most days in the most severe weather to make sure everyone we know of is as warm and safe as possible  providing assistance and resources whenever needed.     The support from the community for all initiatives has been incredible and whilst we are also looking into long term solutions with partner organisations  with the help of continued support and donations we will continue to provide these basic provisions because we know there is still more needed immediately for some of our community’s most vulnerable.     We are thrilled to be in the process of setting up as a registered charity which will enable us to access further funding and support from businesses to be able to secure a premises and reopen a day centre in Hereford. This vision will ensure that those who find themselves homeless are able to access shelter  food and drink  clothing and ongoing support in a neutral  safe and inclusive environment.       To follow our activity and progress please visit our Facebook page at https://m.facebook.com/Herefordhomelesswintersupport/    Thank you so much for your support!  Alice  Jo  Gideon  Lucy  Michelle and Amy  The Hereford Homeless Support Team

Title: Hope 4 Homeless Hull
Location: Driffield, Yorkshire and the Humber, United Kingdom
OrganizationDetails: Registered nonprofitDonations eligible for Gift Aid.
Story: We are a group of 15/16 year olds  who want to make a difference in today’s society. For our NCS social action project  we have decided to dedicate our time to helping the homeless and we will be working along side the Hull Homeless Community Project to do this. We are hoping to raise money so that we can buy daily essentials (that we take for granted for example: clean underwear  toothbrush  toothpaste and many more products as well as food vouchers) to hand out to the homeless. By fundraising £600 this will enable us to make 30 ‘care packages’ to hand out to the homeless people in Hull. However  this is just a target and we would love to smash it! We also aim to make others feel empowered to make a difference. We will be posting on social media throughout our journey as we #hopeforhelp and #hopeforchange

Title: 5k a day – Covid19 Emergency Relief for Homeless
Location: Ware, East of England, United Kingdom
Story: In a bid to do something useful during lockdown  I have decided to fundraise for this amazing charity helping the homeless in London. Since Coronavirus came to the U.K. homelessness has increased  many people losing their jobs and unable to pay their rent have now found themselves on the streets along with the heartbreaking amount that were already living there. Without the foot traffic or leftovers from cafes and restaurants they are in dire need of food  shelter and warm clothes. Under One Sky (www.underonesky.cc) are a volunteer based charity doing everything they can to provide them with these necessities.     As I have no easy access to London right now I thought raising money for them to continue their work  and spreading the word (maybe even encouraging others in the capital to volunteer??) was the best I could do. This is the article that kicked my butt into gear  give it a read if you want to know more about the current situation: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/society/2020/apr/27/london-coronavirus-sacked-hospitality-workers-sleeping-rough    Running - 5k a day  in May    I know this might not sound hard for some  but as a novice runner  who’s never been able to ‘run long distance’  running 5k is still a struggle for me. I’m also very much a fair weather runner  being put off at the slightest bit of rain. So my aim is to run 5k every day for the month of May  come rain or shine. I also am aware that a lot of people are struggling for money at the moment  or out of work completely. So by all means don’t feel like you have to donate if you can’t afford to  or if you can spare as little as £5 it will definitely be appreciated. If you can do anything  volunteer / spread the word / share this info with people who can help  then that too would be amazing.

Title: The Homeless Period Edinburgh Fund
Story: Hello! I'm Kerry :)    Periods are not a great time of the month for any woman  but for homeless women with very limited access to the expensive 'luxury' of sanitary items  it is a truly awful and humiliating time  and because of the taboo that surrounds the topic  it's something that doesn't often cross our mind.    Some women are forced to use ripped up cloths  old socks or toilet roll from public toilets  or make a few tampons last the entire length of their period. This can lead to infections  and so it isn't just the emotional impact - it's also the danger to women's health.    This is why I have joined Keely and the rest of the team at the Albert Street Project in Birmingham in promoting The Homeless Period  to supply the women in Edinburgh with the items they struggle to get access to.    I now co-ordinate the Edinburgh project  collecting donations of wipes  underwear and sanitary items and produce female care packages which are delivered to various projects and shelters across the city    If you would like to help  you can donate here  or drop/send sanitary items to:   The Mash Tun  154 Easter Road  Edinburgh  EH7 5RL    The money and donations go towards creating our special period care packs  which each contain underwear  wipes  and a selection of sanitary products. These packs will be going out to other homeless charities and projects in Edinburgh to make a difference for as many women as possible who are in difficult circumstances  allowing their dignity and health to be maintained through their periods. Title: PLEASE HELP STOP MY EVICTION AFTER 18 YEARS!!!
Story: Hello... My name is Charlene Davis. I am finding this very hard to do and don't even know how to start. For me this is way out of my depth but indeed my situation has gotten so deep I guess I'm desperate and asking for help just seems like the best and only option. So I have a council place  I been living here for 18 years since April 22nd 2002. Prior to then I had lived in many hostels  around 7 or 8. Due to family domestics and breakdowns I was on my iwn from aged 16  my last year of school. I fell pregnant aged 17 and moved into my house with my baby aged 18. I later had another son and made home for the 3 of us. As a young single parent back then  I always had my priorities in.check  I made sure rent  council tax  gas and electricity were taken care of. However  as I was a person who enjoyed their independancy and constantly strived I would seek employment or studies. For some reason this always disrupted my rent account due to the changes. Eventually I was summoned to court for rent arrears eviction back in 2018. I was currently unemployed at the time. I was ordered to pay £133 per month off my rent. The problem I was facing was I was on Universal Credit And my take home pay after all these deductions was £190 per month. Which I was meant to pay £133 towards my arrears. This was ridiculous  unrealistic and started to affect my mental health. I became very depressed  had frequent panic attacks and just a lifeless soul. In 2019  I was diagnosed with ADHD. And I was given the book called 'The Gift of Add in Adults'. It really helped me to understand myself better  and to relate to things  vwhy I felt so different to the world. I began taking my prescribed medication XL Concerta 90mg each day. They were like magic beans. I was no longer depressed and able to gain clarity through the foggy  haze that I'd have in my head. I began to gain my confidence and went bk into the world if work. However  due to personal issues jobs were short lived. But I'd continue to get another job and so on. I literally went downstairs and received this letter today as I Sat 14th March. I feel like a complete waste as I don't have the amount. It's a lot yes but in the sense to become homeless over it feels like a real shame. I mean people reach tens of thousands I am £2897.22 in arrears. Like I said from the very beginning  I cannot believe I am doing this... But I rather fail having tried then failed having never asked for help. At this point my pride is laid down. I will sincerely be greatful for any help you can provide/assist me with.. Please  please share my story  that will be much appreciated too. I'M JUST A NORMAL PERSON. I want to say God bless you from now for your grace and kind hearts. The Lord is all seeing and all knowing and your support will manifest back to you by ten folds. Thankyou in advance for the love and I promise to keep you all updated. With good news  in God's will. Xxx

Title: Help the Homeless: Darren #helpdarren
Location: Leeds, Yorkshire and the Humber, United Kingdom
Story: This is Darren. He is a kindhearted  selfless man who turned 50 on June 14th and your support has been better than any birthday present he could've asked for.    Darren's Story    Darren has been homeless since August 3rd 2018. He comes from a neglecting family - his mother put him in care from an early age and later got re-married  having two more children with her new spouse. She took him back into her home but found she couldn't love him the same way as her new sons  leaving Darren feeling lost  unguided and lonely. Later  he met his wife to be; she worked as a kitchen designer and he was a painter/decorator. He moved in with her and they were together for nine years. After a long battle with mental health  he was advised by doctors to take time off work but this caused arguments with his wife and the eventual end of their relationship. Darren has been on the streets ever since.    Darren spends most of his time outside the Tesco next to Central Village (university halls) in Leeds. He doesn't beg  cause a fuss or take any substances. After several friendly interactions  a few of my friends and I have been helping ensure he is safe and giving him as much support as we can. He's registered with a hostel in Leeds as homeless and can get a night's stay and breakfast for about £5 a night. However  there is only so much we can do as students.    Our Goal    We've learnt so much from Darren  he's shown us more care and appreciation than many people doing far better than him. Through this GoFundMe we hope to give him a head-start in getting back on his feet and give him the fresh start in life that he deserves. 86% of homeless people report problems with their mental health and Darren is part of this shocking statistic. Rates of homelessness in the UK are rising at an alarming rate  so we're hoping that this campaign will show people that a little means a lot to people in these circumstances. Please help us by just doing a little  even if that's the most you can do.    How will we use the money?    The money donated on this page will go towards buying Darren fresh clothes  a haircut and hopefully a more permanent living situation. Even if he just has enough to stay in the hostel more nights than not  he would be unbelievably grateful.    For more information on homelessness in the UK  follow these links:    https://www.homeless.org.uk/facts/homelessness-in-numbers    https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/homelessness-statistics    Please share this story to help Darren and the increasing number of people in his situation.    #HelpTheHomeless #HelpDarren
