Title: Help Anthony the homeless poet get off the streets
Location: Bristol, South West England, United Kingdom
Story: Do you have a backup plan?  Do you have a support network to catch you if you fall?  How many pay cheques are *you* from homelessness?    My name is Laura Kidd - I’m an independent musician based in Bristol releasing music under the name She Makes War  and today I’m writing to ask for your help raising money to get Anthony the homeless poet off the streets and fund his dream of helping other people in his position.    Last Wednesday I was in Bristol city centre early to go to the Post Office before work. Walking along near Castle Park  I gave £5 to a man sitting on the pavement near Starbucks  and found myself drawn into conversation with him. A trained chef  on the streets after losing his job and attached accommodation  he had a notebook set out in front of him. Anthony had started trying to make sense of his situation by writing poems about the people he was meeting throughout the day. Despite having had his bag stolen (containing his work clothes  phone  bank cards and ID) he seemed unbelievably relaxed and philosophical but it was bitterly cold outside and I thought about him all morning  kicking myself for not giving him enough money to at least spend the night in a hostel.    At lunchtime I hurried back to see if Anthony was still there  keen to find out if there were any practical things I could do to help. Giving money to people for hostels or food feels better and more direct than going through other channels  but is only ever a sticking plaster for a much bigger problem. He was happy to see me again and I sat down on the step with him for a while  talking everything through. Anthony is only recently homeless  having just returned to Bristol from working in another city. He doesn’t do drugs  doesn’t even drink much  and feels safer sleeping in a doorway on a busy street than in a hostel. He’s also saving money from public donations to buy new chef’s whites so he can work  so doesn’t want to “waste” the cash he’s given on accommodation as it’s so incredibly hard to save up any meaningful amount. I was surprised to hear that £215 - an achievable sum of money for someone in employment to save up relatively quickly - would cover all the clothing and equipment he’d need  but of course that was only one of the issues keeping Anthony out in the cold.    I asked what the main barriers were to him getting back into work and he said two: his lack of work clothes  and somewhere to have a shower and sleep so he can be presentable for work. Having no address means it’s way harder to apply for a new bank card and ID  impossible to get a mobile phone contract…simple things we take for granted. Without somewhere to stay he can’t keep a job  and without a job he can’t get the money to get a place to live. What a cruel catch-22.    On Thursday and Friday nights I took my live band along to Manchester’s Deaf Institute and Bristol’s The Exchange to support alt rock band Lonely The Brave. I’d given Anthony my number and asked him to send me a wish list of things that would be useful to him. I knew a smartphone would enable him to start looking for work  so my husband Tim dusted off an old one from a drawer and I arranged to pass it on that Friday along with a rucksack and a new toothbrush. We’d also talked quite a bit about poetry and performance  and Anthony had said he wanted to get on stage one day  so it was a simple thing to invite him to come along to the Bristol gig and read a couple of his poems at the end of my set. I wanted to share the platform I’ve carved out for myself from a position of relative privilege with someone who was currently reduced to being ignored by thousands of people every day.    Despite having never read his poetry on stage before  Anthony aced it. I’m so grateful to Lonely The Brave’s audience for being so welcoming and encouraging  and there was a real beauty and power to watching this humble man command the full attention of nearly 200 people. After the gig we managed to raise about £80 to go towards replacing Anthony’s work clothes  and a couple took him home with them that night so he could get a proper night’s sleep and have a shower.    We met up again the next day to talk about what could happen next. Though Anthony continued to ask for absolutely nothing  I decided to pay to put him up in a private hostel room for 7 nights to give him time to rest  regroup and have a chance to take the next steps towards getting his life back. I just couldn't bear the thought of someone I was becoming friends with laying his head in a doorway to sleep. It’s my belief that a quiet  private  clean living space is a basic human right and it felt good to do something meaningful for someone. Unfortunately I’m not in a position to do anything more than this financially  which is why I’m turning to you.    We can’t help everyone  but that doesn’t mean we shouldn’t help anyone. I’m not a religious person  but I have the phrase “There but for the grace of God go I” on a loop in my mind at the moment. If we truly let ourselves feel all the pain and sadness in the world we wouldn’t be able to function  so of course it’s easier to lower our eyes and scurry past the person asking us for help. It can feel hard enough to balance our own financial lives without even starting to think about other people  but if Anthony’s story has touched you at all I would really appreciate your donation  big or tiny.    In his own words:    "So I found myself on the streets  not for the first time in my life. Hopefully the last  but one cannot always know what with possible down turns in economy  redundancy etc. Something that could happen to anyone really.    What brought me here? Well  at 13 I was on the streets for a year or so. Luckily it’s equipped me for this recent outing! Basically from a broken violent home I went into Care. This didn’t define who I was  just what hand I was dealt.    At 16 I went into a kitchen and found I had a gift. I love food - like music it can bring the masses together in a harmony of flavours (or sounds). Throughout my life I have also enjoyed words  of the poetry kind. But never really followed it through.    Anyway  back to why I’m here. Basically  I lost a dear person who meant a lot to me last year. Depression hit  I was frivolous with money and didn’t care for the next day. Being self employed and having my accommodation tied to my job  I lost my job. Which then meant I lost my flat.    I found myself on the streets of Bristol. Having my bag stolen on night one left me without my uniforms or tools to work let alone a change of clothes or a phone! I have since had a total retake on how I view people  the world and life. I have found my love for poetry and embraced it  and have been lucky to have had the chance to share it.    I so badly want to return to work. My dream which keeps me positive is to have a barge or boat  which can ultimately be a bistro by night or cafe by day  with the profits going to then feed the homeless. Or even to franchise/rent a cafe in the evening when not in use so we could use it to make money to use the profits to feed the homeless. My situation may seem severe but I believe that me going back to work will also potentially blossom into something many more people will benefit from.     I believe in the goodness of fellow humans. If we all take 5 minutes of our days to put into society  not to just the homeless but the old lady down the road or the lonely guy next door with no friends  a smile to a fellow person or five mins chatting to a stranger that looks upset.    We have a duty to give  not ignore. To build the society we live in from the inside out. Bristol is unique and gorgeous. Just think of how good we could really make it.    Anthony."    Anthony’s wish list:    “Just basic list really  things to start work  general living things. I put glasses as I had mine in my bag. And struggling without them. Humble but would get me back into a job earning again.”    Work uniform  3 jackets £50  2 trousers £40  4 aprons £25  Shoes £50  Knives £50    Clothing  3 jeans £45  3 t-shirts £15  Underwear £15  Jumper £10    Glasses £80    = £380    If we could raise £500 it could cover all Anthony’s basic needs to get back into work plus give him a nice treat of a year’s supply of Moleskines so he can keep writing poetry (12 x £10 = £120).    BUT without somewhere to stay while applying for jobs it will be impossible for Anthony to stay off the streets  so I’m also hoping to raise more money to keep him safe in his private hostel room for a few weeks. When I first suggested this crowdfunder to him  he said he just wants to be able to get a job  save up and make a plan to settle somewhere  but after a few days of safety and security in the hostel he's feeling more ambitious and has already started setting up meetings to make his dream to feed the homeless a reality. It's inspiring to see. I truly value the time we've spent together over the past week and just hope I can help get him back on his feet.    Thank you so much for reading. If you’re able and happy to donate - thank you again! As Anthony doesn't currently have access to his bank account he's asked me to deal with the donations to start with  the first batch of which will be used to secure temporary accommodation for him right away.    Finally  if you know of any jobs or accommodation in Bristol which might be suitable for Anthony  we’d love to hear from you. Let’s bring someone in from the cold this winter. CONTACT: laura @ laurakidd.co.uk

If she has an address  she could do so much. She was studying for a business qualification when she was kicked out of her house by her previous landlord because the benefits system has changed here in the UK.    It is getting colder and colder and it is unbearable to think that a young person with so much life inside them and so much hope in their eyes is reduced to sitting on a blanket  shivering and begging  and sleeping in a tent at night  in a grave yard. I really think that if she could find herself back in a house  or even in a room  that would mean one less person is lost. She knows that I'm starting this campaign for her.   That is not her in the picture - I wouldn't do that to her  but she has tried all the ways of pulling herself back up and she is on all sorts of waiting lists.     If you can possibly help  by donating even the price of a cup of coffee that would be enormously appreciated.  I will top up with anything else she needs and would make sure that the funds go towards housing for her.    Please let's help to get her into the warm by Christmas.

Title: Homeless Fundraiser Closing 9th November 2019!
Location: Ipswich, East of England, United Kingdom
Story: Hello all       First of all I would like to say a massive thank you for all the support and kind responses that Derek and I have received over the last few days. I cannot stop smiling and it has really being truly overwhelming for us both  it’s something I could not possibly express enough gratitude for. Ashley Alexander whose idea it was to come up with this fundraiser  has tirelessly worked to try and promote this cause over the last few weeks and he feels this is the perfect opportunity to make a difference. Going back to the initial shared post on my Facebook page of myself giving away the trainers  we realised that so many other people’s personal experiences with Derek mirror ours. This convinced us  that we can use this moment as a community to do even more for this very nice and pleasant individual. This GoFundMe page has been setup to see if we could all go one step further for Derek and raise enough money to enable him to put down a deposit and try to get a roof over his head for this winter  the most difficult period of the year for the homeless. Ashley has been working hard over the last few weeks behind the scenes contacting local authorities to see how we can assist this man in regards to gaining an accommodation.      I have seen Derek regularly on the streets for the last 2-3 years in our town of Ipswich and through it all he has always had a smile on his face despite his perilous situation. During this time  I have always wondered to myself  what I could do  if anything to help him get out of his situation. It would mean more than the world to me  if we can work together and achieve this target to allow him to get a fresh start in his life. Every time I see him  he makes me and everyone else feel good about themselves by way of his compliments and positivity  which I  and others genuinely appreciate and this was the motivation of my gesture towards him the other day. We know we cannot help everyone in the world but if we could start by just helping this one  it would make everything that has happened in the last few days all worth it!!!    I want to clarify our intentions in raising the funds for Derek and how we are planning to use it. We are getting in contact with Derek's support worker and the local authorities so we can provide clear updates and transparency to all our donor's with regards to where exactly their money is going and we will provide receipts of every penny that gets spent. We will initially support Derek with engaging with the local authority and relevant agencies so he can get the best outcome possible. Once he has been allocated an accommodation  the donations will go towards his deposit and ensure that his months upfront rent is paid. Remaining funds will then go towards providing him with things like bed sheets and furniture – if needed. If we go over our target for Derek  we will donate the remaining donations to regional charities such as FIND (Families in Need)  Emmaus  Ipswich Locality Homelessness Project (ILHP) who all do a brilliant job in providing support to those who are most vulnerable. We are going to reach out to these charities in the coming weeks  so they are aware of our movement. These charities support trying to combat the issue of homelessness by means of providing food parcels  furniture and support funding emergency accommodation which is going to be crucial in the upcoming months.    Thanks again for all your support!    Connor Robey

Title: Sponsored Homeless Sleep Out

Story: Reports show that almost a 5th of young people are homeless within the UK alone. Title: Helping Hearts Homeless foundation
Location: Stockport, North West England, United Kingdom
Story: This project was started in 2011 in the hope of supporting people in the Greater Manchester area that are sleeping rough.    We began with 2 women walking the streets with a flask and biscuits unsure if they would see any homeless people  but they did  too many in fact.    It soon became obvious what these people needed.... they needed other people!!    Our aim has always been to build relationships built on trust  this has taken time and a lot of commitment but we are now heavily involved and accepted within the homeless community.    we support people on a daily basis meeting basic needs of food  warm clothing  sleeping bags and whatever else is needed.    Following on from this we have been privileged to get to know people and the stories behind what brought someone to the lowest point of their life.    We now support in many different ways  we have helped people gain employment  permanent accomadation  reunite with estranged family members.    We also have helped people access support through the mental health sector  going to appointments with people who have been too afraid to seek out help alone.    We managed to help signpost people to residential rehabilitation centres so to begin the first steps in their journey of building their life back together.    We have had many success stories with people now in full time employment and education  some have their own homes.    We have also had some very sad  heartbreaking stories  we have lost too many friends along the way to pneumonia  poor living conditions  suicide and hyperthermia.    This year we have our annual fundraiser  we only do this once a year because we are not about constantly asking for financial aid  we do of course take donations of clothing  food and other items all year round.    While of course we do receive support in these areas it sometimes isn't enough to meet the high demand so we fundraise once a year in the hope of raising funds to help purchase supplies.    Any help at all will be so greatly appreciated be it a donation of money  supplies or your time volunteering in distributing food etc    If anyone would like to contact us directly then please feel free via our website where you will find all contact details.    Www.helpinghearts.co.uk  https://www.facebook.com/events/1882256018670463/?ti=cl      Thank you so much for taking the time to read through our request.  Help spread the word!

Title: Helping Homeless People In Ashford
Location: Ashford, South East England, United Kingdom
Story: Since November a group of local mums in Ashford have been cooking meals and going out every evening to feed our homeless community so that they get a hot meal and drink every single day. In January they joined forces with Unleashing Lives to work together to help as many homeless people in Ashford. We rely on donations to continue the work we do. There are currently approximately 17 homeless people that we are feeding a day with a hot meal and drink. Some choose to use the homeless shelter  others don't due to extreme mental health. If anyone can find it in their heart to help towards donating to allow us to provide even more hot meals to the homeless community even if its 10p as it all adds up  we would be truly grateful. Even if you have food  clothing  toiletries that you would like to donate  we would be extremely grateful and you can email us at: info@unleashinglives.org.uk for us to collect or advise of our drop off points. Read more at our work at: www.unleashinglives.org.uk    Thank you for taking the time to read.

Title: Help a homeless person raise a rent deposit
Location: High Pittington, North East England, United Kingdom
Story: On 25th Oct  in Durham I spoke to a number of homeless people. I offered a bed to one young man named Kirk. His story has moved me and I wanted to do something to help get in a home. He missed out on his education but still as bright as a button  moved from home to home as a child  brother who committed suicide  no work that has afforded him to afford a place to live alone  homeless for the last few months  depression (not surprising) but despite all this he is polite  a little shy  as clean and presentable as possible when and you live on the streets and has hope that one day his situation will change. He needs money for a deposit for a flat so that he can have a base in order to apply for jobs. He has never asked me or the public for money. He may not have achieved qualifications at school but there are lots of things he'd be interested in and capable of doing. He'd love to work in demolition. I'm reaching out to my friends and family in two ways. If you could find it in your hearts to donate even the smallest amount it will all add up to reach a deposit for accomodation. Another way you could help would be to offer him work if you are in a position to do so. Thank you all. Please please help me to help him find a life for himself.

Title: Glasgow night homeless ministry

We will also use any money for donated to secure accomodation through hostels & bed and breakfasts  because no one deserves to be on the streets especially at winter time. We would appreciate any help you can give us and im sure if we all come together we can make a difference Thank you for any support you can offer. Thank you ❤.    #Glasgownightministryhelpthehomeless

Title: Help raise money for the homeless & those in need
Story: A little bit about us....      We are an entirely self funded volunteer led group of like minded local people  young and old  who wanted to do something to help the homeless and needy in our neighbourhood. So in November 2018 we founded the Tooting Community Kitchen. Since then we have run a weekly distribution of hot food  and essential supplies. We now have over 50 volunteers and we have been able to assist hundreds of people........so far!    Currently  every Saturday evening our volunteers are able to provide the following help:    • We distribute food packs to a local shelter for homeless people  • We set up a stall from 6.30pm to 7.30pm next to Tooting Broadway Market where we serve hot food  soups  drinks and hand out toiletries and sanitary products  • Our outreach volunteers visit known places where homeless people sleep in the local community and we provide them with a hot meal  a hot drink  toiletries and sanitary products and sleeping bags  • Our outreach teams are now able to serve people in Wandsworth (Southside area)  Clapham Junction  Putney High Street  and Clapham South / Common / and North.      We urgently need donations so this much needed work can carry in the community.     Please help us to help those in need.      Tooting Community Kitchen

Title: Feed the NHS and the Homeless
Story: We are looking to raise £5000 to help with purchasing of stock  packaging and delivery of 2000 to 2500 meals across Glasgow and the surrounding areas. We will be making fresh meals and delivering to NHS staff  homeless and anybody in need.    This will be facilitated by McFlys Wing Bar and Brisket & Bagel - festival catering businesses which have unfortunately ground to a halt due as a result of the ongoing crisis. We have the skills  resources and a commercial kitchen with the ability to make fresh  healthy meals in bulk and feed a large number of people at cost price.     NHS staff are working 18 hour shifts  with no cafeteria facilities after 5pm. Many are forced to eat from vending machines and are too tired to cook when they return home. We have already supplied a number of meals to the maternity unit at the Royal infirmary. We hope to continue and increase our contribution in this way.    Glasgow's homeless have all been housed in shelters and hostels around the city. Although they have been given a roof over their heads  most do not have any facilities to cook or prepare meals and without being allowed on the streets they have no means of making money to buy food.     We don’t need much £2.00 - £2.50 will allow us to feed someone with a healthy  filling and tasty meal and we can produce 100’s of meals a day. Help us to do what we can to keep our key workers going and help those in need.

Title: Feeding homeless program during Ramadan 2019
Location: Bolton, North West England, United Kingdom
Story: Hello!    The Moroccan charity  Open Hands  is a not-for-profit organisation  which runs various volunteering projects to support the community. Projects include supporting orphanages  children and adults with disabilities  delivering activities for children on the streets  and feeding the homeless.     During the holy month of Ramadan  Open Hands runs a food kitchen for the homeless  in Marrakech. Food is provided for 120 homeless people everyday for Iftar  over the 30 days (05/05/19 - 04/06/19). As Ramadan is fast approaching  i am (hopefully) fundraising £800 (10 000 MAD) to fund the feeding homeless project during Ramadan. All money raised goes directly towards buying food and cooking materials for the project.     Last May  i volunteered with Open Hands and supported this project throughout the holy month of Ramadan. All the volunteers at Open Hands do an incredible job and providing food for the homeless community in Marrakech was a very rewarding experience! Please watch the youtube video and see the attached pictures to see just how much of a difference our donations make.     As you can see from the pictures  we have limited resources and feed a vast number of people over the course of the month. It is important that we have enough funds to run the programme successfully. Basic things  such as bowls  plates and plastic cups  are needed as well as food ingredients. If anyone would like to donate or send plastic plates  cups etc. i can take these donations or send you an address.     Thanks in advance everyone! :)

Title: The Homeless Period Liverpool
Location: Liverpool, North West England, United Kingdom
Story: Hello all.    My name is Natalie Denny and I am an Education and Training Manager from Liverpool. Thank you so much for taking the time to look at The Homeless Period Liverpool fundraising page. Periods are not a great time of the month for any woman  but for homeless women with very limited access to the expensive 'luxury' of sanitary items  it is a truly awful and humiliating time  and because of the taboo that surrounds the topic  it's something that doesn't often cross our mind. Some women are forced to use ripped up cloths  old socks or toilet roll from public toilets  or make a few tampons last the entire length of their period. This can lead to infections  so it doesn't just have an emotional impact but is a danger to women's physical health. This is why I have joined The Homeless Period Team  to supply the women in Liverpool with the items they struggle to get access to. We are all volunteers and will be collecting donations of wipes  underwear and sanitary items and produce female care packages which are delivered to various projects and shelters across the city If you would like to help  you can donate here. We will also be setting up donation stations and will provide the address to send donations to once they are confirmed. The money and donations go towards creating our special period care packs  which each contain underwear  wipes  and a selection of sanitary products. These packs will be going out to other homeless charities and projects in Liverpool to make a difference for as many women as possible who are in difficult circumstances  allowing their dignity and health to be maintained through their periods. Thank you again for visiting our page. We are incredibly grateful for the support and donations given to our cause no matter how big or small! Natalie  <3

Title: Aid for homeless refugees
Story: We are a group of independent organisations and individuals working together to meet the needs of homeless refugees in Thessaloniki  Greece.    The majority of the people we work with are young men from Algeria  Morocco  Pakistan  and Afghanistan. Whilst there are a number of centres set up for families or women and children  there are little to no services being provided for this particular group. Due to a perceived lack of necessity  they are also unlikely to be granted papers in any European country.     The target of this page has been set at £5 000 but really this is an ongoing campaign. In the winter we fundraise to supply hats  scarves  thermal socks  and underwear. In the summer we supply mosquito spray and hygiene packs. All year round there is an ongoing need for medicines  shoes  and backpacks. The population is changing constantly with movement between borders  so we can never have 'enough' donations and supplies.

Title: #FeedingLDN2019
Location: South Croydon, Greater London, United Kingdom
Story: We want to give back again this Christmas :)     We will be working with the Single Homeless Project (SHP) to host a Christmas dinner at one of the hostels they work with - the Dennis Handfield House.     A group of volunteers will be cooking and serving the dinner on Christmas eve and spending some time with the individuals who will be attending the dinner and hopefully help them create some lovely Christmas memories.     We are looking to raise £250 to primarily pay for the ingredients  however if we exceed our target  we will be putting together some care packages to give out to a few people around London who will be sleeping on the streets.     Please give whatever you can  even if our target is not met  Wooden Spoon LDN will be matching what is raised to still make the Christmas dinner at the Dennis Handfield House possible.       Some background information:   Rough sleeping and homelessness has become a crisis in London. The number of rough sleepers has increased by 1 371 totaling over 8 000 people in the year ending March 2019. Furthermore  the homeless experience a wide range of issues such as lack of food  drink  shelter  medical care and sanitation products.     Many people tend to spend time with the friends and family during Christmas. However  those who are homeless often go without some of the pleasures many experience during the festive period. #FeedingLDN aims to provide those who are homeless with food  water and other daily essentials as well as some kind words to ensure that they do not go without food and love during the festive period.       Thank you for taking the time to read this  and thank you for your donations!     Merry Christmas :)    Here are some photos from last year’s #FeedingLDN     http://www.woodenspoonldn.co.uk/csr

Title: Please help my friend, homeless after fleeing DV
Location: Gravesend, South East England, United Kingdom
Story: Can you help even in the smallest way?     My beautiful friend and her lovely child are being made homeless from a domestic violence refuge in 2 weeks time.     They have exhausted all options in fighting this  minus a legal challenge which would be costly  time consuming and utterly draining on a traumatised and exhausted mum. So the funds are for two things - to provide a suitable short term let  and to help fund a preloved static caravan so they have some stability and peace while she can contemplate her next (long term) move.     They have been in a number of refuge accommodation for 3 years now after having to flee their home from domestic violence. They have been 2 years with the same council and have been on the waiting list for housing in that time. They are still not close to getting a council or HA home due to the excessive demand in the area.       They have been offered a room in a hostel  with shared facilities which is wholly unsuitable due to disabilities and health issues that they both have  this has been backed up by occupational therapists and paediatric consultants. Social services have also admitted this is not suitable but there is nothing else they will provide for them.     They have also been told they cannot bring her son’s cat. For a traumatised autistic child this just isn’t an option my friend can contemplate.     Private landlords will not even consider her due to one or all of needing possible future adaptations for disabilities  a pet  housing benefit. She also needs a very long term landlord due to these health issues and they both just need some stability and somewhere they can lay down roots.     I would be so grateful if you could help  it breaks my heart everyday to see this happening to them and not being able to do anything meaningful about it. I know once they have been able to heal from this awful period in their lives that my friend will give back in so many ways. She has a lot of insight into the way we as a country treat our most vulnerable.     Thank you.     For their safety I cannot share any information about their location.

Title: Homeless and Rough Sleeper Crisis
Location: Hove, South East England, United Kingdom
Story: The numbers of rough sleepers are increasing  so far we have managed to rise to the task of providing life saving kit along with food and provisions right across the city of Brighton and other parts of Sussex. The latest official numbers show around an 130% increase in Rough Sleeping and more than double the numbers managing to get into some sort of temp or emergency accommodation where homeless often struggle because of the lack of normal household items  we are providing these essential items as part of our remit. These items sometimes are as simple as plates and cutlery but sometimes we provide microwaves  radios and even TV's which encourage the clients to spend more time in their rooms making it easier to engage with services and keeping them away from the dangers on the streets. We also supply food drops giving them a start till their benefits catch up.    New shelters alongside the established ones are helping more this year than ever but they still for whatever reason between them only cover less than half of the rough sleepers  we are servicing the rest approx 120. On top we are providing a weekly full meal alongside clothing and provisions to the many who for whatever reason will not engage with the more established services.    Our commitment to working towards a solution for homelessness could not be more evident as is our ability to provide a free and unrestricted service to some of the hardest or most vulnerable in the city  we turn no one away.    We would formally like to request consideration for a funding grant from either the Homeless Support Funds or/and Prevention of Homeless Funds. An award would see us safely through to the end of winter period and we have estimated the increase in extra provisions will leave us having to find approx £9400 to cover running costs till then. Our volunteers are all donating themeselves just to keep the charity running  no one receives wages in fact most are paying to work. We are a small charity fighting the biggest crisis in UK right now.

Title: Hair for the Homeless
Organization: Shelter, National Campaign for Homeless People Limited
OrganizationDetails: Registered nonprofitDonations eligible for Gift Aid.
Story: With the crazy and uncertain state of the world right now  most of us take it for granted that we are able to socially distance within our own homes  keeping us safe with the security of a stable  clean home. Sadly  not everybody is able to do that. There are still thousands of homeless people living in Scotland  many of whom are living on the streets  with others living in unsanitary  cramped accommodations  where distancing is not an option. There are also many people facing uncertainty within their own homes  as thousands across the country lose their incomes and begin to struggle to pay rent and mortgages. Shelter works to change this  providing advice and help to those in need  from legal advice to setting up accommodation. They also campaign with and against local authorities and the government  to protect against and change systematic injustice.   I don’t think it’s any secret that Shelter is a cause that has been very close to my heart for the last few years  (in fact i’m sure some of you are sick of me going on about it)  but I am once again asking for your help.   Anyone who knows me knows I have been growing my hair for the past 5 years  and it is now reaching almost my mid back. If we are able to raise £200 for Shelter  I will cut my hair. I’ll also do so on video  to further the pain!   Please  please help me to achieve this. No one should be living without a suitable home  or with the uncertainty of whether they will be able to keep their home  in times like this.   Once the goal of £200 is reached  I will be doing a stream on Facebook Live of me losing my beautiful flowing locks  so you all know I have held up my end of the bargain  so please look out for that!  Thank you in advance for all of your help and support.

Title: Happy go lucky homeless man

Title: Street Schools for Homeless Children, India
Story: I have now been in India for a little over 2 months  and the focus of my efforts has changed a little.    There is a huge problem in Kullu and Bhuntar with homeless children who are not going to school  at all. As such  they are completely trapped in a spiral of deprivation  as they cannot acquire skills to help them get work  and therefore they cannot earn money to "move on".    Alongside the voluntary teaching in schools that i have been doing  i have now set up 2 "Street Schools". These are basic  very basic indeed. So far  this consists of evening "classes" for a little over 150 children per week.    I need money for 3 things. Firstly  i want to expand the scope of these two provisions to cover 4 additional slum areas locally. Secondly  i would like to provide a very basic hot meal to children. And thirdly  i want to continue to provide the very basics of eduction to the children. This would include exercise books  pencils  pencil cases  and some simple reading books.    Please help. Even if you have helped before  please see it in your heart to help again. I cannot begin to describe either the level of need that exists  or the tangible difference that this work is already making. Seeing children smile that otherwise have nothing to smile about in life should make YOU  you generous people  feel that you are part of what i want to achieve.    The lives that some children live is beyond comprehension. Together  we can create a provision that could change that for years to come around here.     I will continue to throw all my effort  available cash  and the preverbial "kitchen sink" at this.     Please  be part of it. All my love xx
